maml:description.maml:para: Sets the PokemonTCG API key
The Add-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlet sets the PokemonTCG API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to PokemonTCG
An API key is not required to use the PokemonTCG API. However if you aren't using an API key, you are rate limited to 1000 requests a day, and a maximum of 30 per minute
A PokemonTCG API key can be acquired via an account on https://dev.pokemontcg.io/

dev:remarks.maml:para: No API key is set
Sets the API key to the defined value
Sets the API key to the defined value

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the PokemonTCG API
The Add-PokemonTCGBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2 which is PokemonTCG's default URI
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.celerium.org will be used for all API calls to PokemonTCG's API

maml:description.maml:para: Gets PokemonTCG cards
The Get-PokemonTCGCard cmdlet gets PokemonTCG cards individually, in bulk, & or with advanced query filters (Filters are case-sensitive)
Details on allowed queries can be found at https://docs.pokemontcg.io/api-reference/cards/card-object
The id of the card
A comma delimited list of fields to return in the response
By default, all fields are returned if not defined
A comma delimited list of fields to return in the response
By default, all fields are returned if not defined
The search query
The field(s) to order the results by
Defines the page number to return
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use the page parameter
The id of the card
A comma delimited list of fields to return in the response
By default, all fields are returned if not defined
The search query
The field(s) to order the results by
Defines the page number to return
Defines the amount of items to return with each page
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use the page parameter

maml:alert.maml:para: The PokemonTCG card object contains the following attributes: (https://docs.pokemontcg.io/api-reference/cards/card-object#attributes) id string name string supertype string subtypes list(string) level string hp string types list(string) evolvesFrom string evolvesTo list(string) rules list(string) ancientTrait hash abilities list(hash) attacks list(hash) weaknesses list(hash) resistances list(hash) retreatCost list(string) convertedRetreatCost integer set hash number string artist string rarity string flavorText string nationalPokedexNumbers list(integer) legalities hash regulationMark string images hash tcgplayer hash cardmarket hash

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the first 250 PokemonTCG cards
Returns the PokemonTCG ditto object with the defined id
Returns the PokemonTCG ditto object with the defined id
Returns the first 250 ditto's from the PokemonTCG API
Returns the first 250 ditto's from the PokemonTCG API
Returns the first 250 pokemon from any base set starting with the defined term from the PokemonTCG API
Progress information is sent to the console while the cmdlet is running
Returns the first 250 water type pokemon from any base set starting with the defined term from the PokemonTCG API
Progress information is sent to the console while the cmdlet is running

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the PokemonTCG API key
The Add-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlet sets the PokemonTCG API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to PokemonTCG
An API key is not required to use the PokemonTCG API. However if you aren't using an API key, you are rate limited to 1000 requests a day, and a maximum of 30 per minute
A PokemonTCG API key can be acquired via an account on https://dev.pokemontcg.io/
Defines your API secret key
Defines your API secret key

dev:remarks.maml:para: No API key is set
Sets the API key to the defined value
Sets the API key to the defined value

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the PokemonTCG API
The Add-PokemonTCGBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls
Define the base URI for the PokemonTCG API connection
Define the base URI for the PokemonTCG API connection

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2 which is PokemonTCG's default URI
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.celerium.org will be used for all API calls to PokemonTCG's API

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
The Invoke-PokemonTCGRequest cmdlet converts & formats uri filter parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the Invoke-PokemonTCGRequest & any public functions that define parameters
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resourceURI parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resourceURI parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example: (From public function) $uriFilter = @{}
ForEach ( $Key in $PSBoundParameters.GetEnumerator() ) { if( $excludedParameters -contains $Key.Key ) {$null} else{ $uriFilter += @{ $Key.Key = $Key.Value } } }
1x key = https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2/cards?q=name:ditto' 2x key = https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2/cards?q=types:water&select=id,name'

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the PokemonTCG BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file
The Export-PokemonTCGModuleSettings cmdlet exports the PokemonTCG BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work
Define the location to store the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the name of the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the name of the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's PokemonTCG configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's PokemonTCG configuration file located at: C:\PokemonTCG\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the PokemonTCG API key
The Get-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlet gets the PokemonTCG API key global variable
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the PokemonTCG API key global variable and returns it as a SecureString
Gets the PokemonTCG API key global variable and returns it as plain text

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the PokemonTCG base URI global variable
The Get-PokemonTCGBaseURI cmdlet shows the PokemonTCG base URI global variable value

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the PokemonTCG base URI global variable value

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved PokemonTCG configuration settings
The Get-PokemonTCGModuleSettings cmdlet gets the saved PokemonTCG configuration settings from the local system
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the location to store the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the name of the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the PokemonTCG configuration file
Define the location to store the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the name of the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the PokemonTCG configuration file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the contents of the configuration file that was created with the Export-PokemonTCGModuleSettings
The default location of the PokemonTCG configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the PokemonTCG configuration file in this example is: C:\PokemonTCG\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the PokemonTCG BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to the current session
The Import-PokemonTCGModuleSettings cmdlet imports the PokemonTCG BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information stored in the PokemonTCG configuration file to the users current session
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the location to store the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the name of the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the name of the PokemonTCG configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-PokemonTCGModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session
The default location of the PokemonTCG configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG\config.psd1
Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-PokemonTCGModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session
The location of the PokemonTCG configuration file in this example is: C:\PokemonTCG\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Makes an API request
The Invoke-PokemonTCGRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to PokemonTCG API
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
As of 2024-11 the PokemonTCG v2 API only supports GETrequests
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-PokemonTCGQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resourceURI parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $PokemonTCG_BaseURI + $resourceURI + ConvertTo-PokemonTCGQueryString
Place holder parameter to use when other methods are supported by the PokemonTCG v2 API
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use the page parameter
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-PokemonTCGQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resourceURI parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $PokemonTCG_BaseURI + $resourceURI + ConvertTo-PokemonTCGQueryString
Place holder parameter to use when other methods are supported by the PokemonTCG v2 API
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use the page parameter

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke a rest method against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters
Example: Name Value ---- ----- method GET Uri https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2/cards?q=name:ditto Headers {X-Api-Key = 123456789} Body

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the PokemonTCG API key
The Remove-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlet removes the PokemonTCG API key global variable
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the PokemonTCG API key global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the PokemonTCG base URI global variable
The Remove-PokemonTCGBaseURI cmdlet removes the PokemonTCG base URI global variable
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the PokemonTCG base URI global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored PokemonTCG configuration folder
The Remove-PokemonTCGModuleSettings cmdlet removes the PokemonTCG folder and its files This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive PokemonTCG variables as well
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define the location of the PokemonTCG configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define if sensitive PokemonTCG variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Define the location of the PokemonTCG configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Define if sensitive PokemonTCG variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does
The default location of the PokemonTCG configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\PokemonTCG
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does If sensitive PokemonTCG variables exist then they are removed as well
The location of the PokemonTCG configuration folder in this example is: C:\PokemonTCG

maml:description.maml:para: Test the PokemonTCG API key
The Test-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlet tests the base URI & API key that were defined in the Add-PokemonTCGBaseURI & Add-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlets
Define the base URI for the PokemonTCG API connection using PokemonTCG's URI or a custom URI
The default base URI is https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2
Define the base URI for the PokemonTCG API connection using PokemonTCG's URI or a custom URI
The default base URI is https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-PokemonTCGBaseURI & Add-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlets
The default full base uri test path is: https://api.pokemontcg.io/v2/types
Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-PokemonTCGBaseURI & Add-PokemonTCGApiKey cmdlets
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://myapi.gateway.celerium.org/types

By default, all fields are returned if not defined

When using this parameter there is no need to use the page parameter

maml:alert.maml:para: The PokemonTCG sets object contains the following attributes: (https://docs.pokemontcg.io/api-reference/sets/set-object#attributes) id string name string series string printedTotal integer total integer legalities hash ptcgoCode string releaseDate string updatedAt string images hash
